intro: Gomphostemma ovatum, commonly known as the smooth false indigo, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Gomphostemma ovatum is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks.
